bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 27, 1895

div1.p: Reed is sorry Blincoe's son, Lemuel, has left home. He gives advice on raising violets.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 27, 1895

opener.dateline:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
U. S. ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY,
Corner 7th and B Streets S. W.,
Washington, D. C., Sept 27, 1895

div1.p:
I have just
returned to the city from my
Annual leave -- was very
much reduced in weight
& so ran up to the mountains
of Pennsylvania & Maryland
for a little outing - gained
20 lbs, & come back feeling
as gay as a goat- you will
now understand why you
have not heard from me.
Sorry to hear that Lem has
gone away from home -
Hope that he hasn't made
any mistake, but that
he will flourish and expand-
so you & Nita are going to
try violet culture? Are you
posted on the subject? Do so
before you begin. If I can
give you any advice or
assistance in starting,
let me know - Don't have
your frames too hot - & be sure
to have them exposed to a
southern sun. They are not
difficult to raise - write and
tell me how you are going
to do, and I may be able to
correct some errors - I am
a “way-back” farmer - in-
herit it from my father.
Where are you going to
get your plants? Has it
been hot down your way?
Washington has been roast-
ing- Emily & Blossom are
still in the Country - Too hot
to let them come home-
